revised_title: Lamellae and their organization in melt-crystallized polymers
tldr: The article discusses the organization and formation of lamellae in melt-crystallized polymers, focusing on their role in creating spherulites and the impact on the properties of the material. The authors explain how lamellae are not all equivalent and that their mutual disposition is crucial for the overall structure. They also describe the distortion of lamellae during growth and the influence of factors such as temperature and time on the resulting texture.
